humanMachineDialogue.author: Memory Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The report mentions 'Metastases carcinomatosae in lymphonodis axillae (No IX/XI) (NHG2, pTIc, pN2a)'. This indicates that there are metastases in 4 to 9 axillary lymph nodes, which corresponds to N2 according to Rule 14 and New Rule 15 (N2a). Therefore, the N stage for this patient is N2.

humanMachineDialogue.author: ZS Reasoning
humanMachineDialogue.text: The N stage for axillary lymph node metastasis is determined by the number of positive lymph nodes. In this report, it is mentioned that there are metastases in lymph nodes No. IX and XI. This indicates that there are at least 2 positive lymph nodes. Therefore, the N stage is N2 (N1: 1-3 positive lymph nodes, N2: 4-9 positive lymph nodes, N3: 10 or more positive lymph nodes).
